body_html:
In fact, if I run cat /proc/cpuinfo and look at flags there is no avx for certain. On Tue, Nov 6, 2018 at 6:01 PM Asterion Daedalus < organicmonkeymotion@gmail.com> wrote:
…
Hmm. I did say AMD64 but that was a furphy. The laptop is acutally an x64 being an intel i5 which (apparently) has AVX according to good old wikipedia. BUT if I look I have a i5 460M chip, which intel tells me has Intel® SSE4.1, Intel® SSE4.2 extensions. I am still trying to get my head around it but yes, if AVX is separated to SSE4.1 and 4.2 then my playing with tensorflow is kaput. It the lack of AVX would certainly account for both the docker and pip install attempts failing. Thanks ymodak, I will delete my install of tensorflow and look at other frameworks. On Tue, Nov 6, 2018 at 8:09 AM ymodak ***@***.***> wrote: > I suspect that your CPU doesn't support AVX instructions > <https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Advanced_Vector_Extensions#CPUs_with_AVX> > which is a requirement for installing TensorFlow 1.6 and above. > > — > You are receiving this because you authored the thread. > Reply to this email directly, view it on GitHub > <#23520 (comment)>, > or mute the thread > <https://github.com/notifications/unsubscribe-auth/ABsMK2vMYNEd-jfpaFy1RAvOhQRwRpSLks5usLAMgaJpZM4YOP82> > . >
body_text:
In fact, if I run cat /proc/cpuinfo and look at flags there is no avx for
certain.

On Tue, Nov 6, 2018 at 6:01 PM Asterion Daedalus <
organicmonkeymotion@gmail.com> wrote:
…
 Hmm.  I did say AMD64 but that was a furphy.

 The laptop is acutally an x64 being an intel i5 which (apparently) has AVX
 according to good old wikipedia.

 BUT if I look I have a i5 460M chip, which intel tells me has Intel®
 SSE4.1, Intel® SSE4.2 extensions.  I am still trying to get my head around
 it but yes, if AVX is separated to SSE4.1 and 4.2 then my playing with
 tensorflow is kaput.

 It the lack of AVX would certainly account for both the docker and pip
 install attempts failing.

 Thanks ymodak, I will delete my install of tensorflow and look at other
 frameworks.


 On Tue, Nov 6, 2018 at 8:09 AM ymodak ***@***.***> wrote:

> I suspect that your CPU doesn't support AVX instructions
> <https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Advanced_Vector_Extensions#CPUs_with_AVX>
> which is a requirement for installing TensorFlow 1.6 and above.
>
> —
> You are receiving this because you authored the thread.
> Reply to this email directly, view it on GitHub
> <#23520 (comment)>,
> or mute the thread
> <https://github.com/notifications/unsubscribe-auth/ABsMK2vMYNEd-jfpaFy1RAvOhQRwRpSLks5usLAMgaJpZM4YOP82>

body:
In fact, if I run cat /proc/cpuinfo and look at flags there is no avx for
certain.

> It the lack of AVX would certainly account for both the docker and pip

> Thanks ymodak, I will delete my install of tensorflow and look at other
